unnormalised: So, I've been seeing a lot of buzz around scholarship portals lately, especially for students in India, and thought I'd share my two cents. Are these things actually helpful, or are they just another way for companies to collect our data?
normalised: So, I have been seeing a lot of buzz around scholarship portals lately, especially for students in India, and thought I would share my two cents. Are these things actually helpful, or are they just another way for companies to collect our data?

unnormalised: I remember back when my younger sister, Priya, was applying for her engineering course at IIT Delhi, she was practically drowning in paperwork. We spent weeks sifting through different websites and brochures just to find the eligibility criteria for each scholarship. It felt like a Bollywood drama, honestly - so much tension!
normalised: I remember back when my younger sister, Priya, was applying for her engineering course at I I T Delhi, she was practically drowning in paperwork. We spent weeks sifting through different websites and brochures just to find the eligibility criteria for each scholarship. It felt like a Bollywood drama, honestly dash so much tension!

unnormalised: Now, these scholarship portals promise to aggregate all that information in one place. Think of it like Flipkart for scholarships, haha. You can filter by course, location (India, obviously!), caste, income level (you know, the whole shebang). Sounds amazing, right?
normalised: Now, these scholarship portals promise to aggregate all that information in one place. Think of it like Flipkart for scholarships, ha ha. You can filter by course, location (India, obviously!), caste, income level (you know, the whole shebang). Sounds amazing, right?

unnormalised: But here's the thing: always double-check the information on the official scholarship provider's website. Sometimes these portals are outdated or, worse, scams. Make sure they're a reputable site with good reviews before handing over your personal details.
normalised: But here's the thing: always double dash check the information on the official scholarship provider's website. Sometimes these portals are outdated or, worse, scams. Make sure they are a reputable site with good reviews before handing over your personal details.

unnormalised: Also, don't rely solely on these portals. Talk to your professors, career counselors, and even alumni at your college. They might know about scholarships that aren't widely advertised online.
normalised: Also, don't rely solely on these portals. Talk to your professors, career counselors, and even alumni at your college. They might know about scholarships that are not widely advertised online.
